required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Factor IX Gene Therapy Study (FIX-GT)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Open Label, Multicentre, Ascending Single Dose, Safety Study of a Novel Adeno- Associated Viral Vector (FLT180a) in Patients With Haemophilia B

brief_summary.textblock:
Severe haemophilia B is a bleeding disorder where a protein made by the body to help make blood clot is either partly or completely missing. This protein is called a clotting factor; with severe haemophilia B, levels of clotting factor IX (FIX) (nine) are very low and affected individuals can suffer life threatening bleeding episodes. HB mainly affects boys and men (normally one in every 30,000 males). Current treatment for HB involves intravenous infusions of factor IX as regular treatment (Prophylaxis) or 'on demand'. On demand treatment is highly effective at stopping bleeding but cannot fully reverse long-term damage that follows after a bleed. Regular treatment can prevent bleeding, however can be invasive for patients and also expensive. This research study aims to test the safety and effectiveness of a gene therapy which produces Factor IX protein in the body. The gene will be given using an inactivated virus called "the vector" ( FLT180a), in a single infusion. The vector has been developed from a virus known as an adeno- associated virus, that has been changed so that it is unable to cause a viral infection in humans. This "inactivated" virus is further altered to carry the Factor IX gene and to make its way within liver cells where Factor IX protein is normally made.
Up to three different doses cohorts of FLT180a will be tested, in up to 24 patients with severe haemophilia B. Patients will be recruited from haemophilia centres in the EU and US. Patients will be in the trial for approximately 40 weeks and will undergo procedures including physical examinations, bloods tests, ECGs and liver ultrasounds.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Terminated early due to challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic and a change in requirements of data to be submitted for marketing authorisation.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of treatment-emergent Adverse Events (Safety)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be coded using CTCAE version 5.0 Frequency of treatment-emergent AEs will be calculated for each body system and preferred term, and by dose cohort, for number of events and number of patients reporting the event. The severity of the AEs and the relationship to study medication will be summarised for each body system and preferred term by cohort.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients achieving clinical FIX response and proportion of patient achieving normalised FIX response at Week 26, at the terminal dose level. A clinical FIX response is defined as achieving a FIX activity of 5% to 150%. Normalised FIX response is defined as achieving FIX activity in the normal range (50-150%).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in FIX concentrate consumption.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in annualised bleeding rate

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response to the hFIX transgene product (i.e., development of inhibitors) will be assessed by measurement of the level of inhibitors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response to the AAV capsid will be assessed by measurement of the neutralising antibody titre.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: T-cell responses to AAV capsid will be assessed in peripheral blood mononuclear cells.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Serum and bodily secretions will be collected to assess clearance of vector genomes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients achieving FIX activity at or above 5%, 15%, 30%, 40%, 50%, 70% and 150% of normal, at each scheduled visit, will be summarised by dose and overall. Change from baseline in FIX activity as a percentage of normal values will be summarised.

other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 score.

other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Haemophilia Activities List (HAL) 2005.

other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the EQ-5D-5L and Haem-A-QoL score.

other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the PROBE score.

other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Haemophilia Joint Health Score (HJHS).

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - haemophilia related medical appointments
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of haemophilia related medical appointments and medical activities

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - number of emergency room visits
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of emergency room visits

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - number of hospitalisations
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of hospitalisations related to haemophilia

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - length of hospital stays
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on length of haemophilia related hospital stays

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - work and education days lost
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of days lost from education or work due to bleeding episodes

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - physiotherapy and professional sessions
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of physiotherapy sessions, specialist consultations and appointments with professional caregivers.

other_outcome.measure: Health resource utilisation - visits to site
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of health resource utilisation based on number of visits to site

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline or abnormal finding from routine safety assessments
other_outcome.time_frame: From screening until week 26 post infusion
other_outcome.description: Safety as assessed by reporting of abnormal or change from baseline findings from routine safety assessments including, laboratory assessments, vital signs, ECG, physical exam and liver ultrasound.

intervention.description: FLT180a is a replication-incompetent adeno- associated viral vector. The vector is composed of a DNA vector genome encapsidated in an adeno-associated virus derived protein capsid. The expression cassette contains DNA encoding Factor IX.

overall_official.affiliation: University College London / Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

facility.name: Guy's and St Thomas's NHS Foundation Trust
